154212111111111211.content:
You are happy to see Cathy take a turn away from the more crowded streets and lead you through a smaller park. Other than some kids on the playground in the distance, you don't suppose you're gonna bump into anyone for another while.
But slowly, you realize you can hear a sound of spinning wheels getting louder.
As you are about to turn your head to look for the source, a couple of skateboarders whizz pass you, the wind making your hair, skirt and sleeves flutter. You're sure you saw them checking you both out on their way, and you silently pray they will just continue ahead and vanish, but the leader seems to be slowing down, and it makes the other two to gradually come to a brake as well. They stop quite far ahead, on the side of the alley, but Cathy doesn't seem to be changing the direction and the road will eventually lead you right to them.
You begin to slow down, wishing you could just turn around and walk the other way.
"Umm...Cathy...?" you begin as you see them definitely taking quick looks in your direction.
"Don't even start, Mark..." Cathy grits between her teeth. "They are just some skaters. Do you think the streets are less crowded?"
You must admit Cathy's probably taking the less-threatening way. So you just keep up, but try to stay one step behind her, planning to hide from their line of sight as she advances towards them nonchalantly.
As you are getting closer, you can see the three young guys doing elaborate trick-jumps and cheering for each other. But with horror you notice Cathy slowing down and applauding as well, addressing them in a cute tone.
"That's some neat skills you got there, boys..." she says, as you ponder if she's seriously doing this to piss you off.
"Thanks, babe!" The first guy says, kicking the board to his hand. "Do you want to try and have a go?"
"Oh no, I haven't ever done it before!" Cathy answers, waving her hand.
"Come on, we'll teach you how to do it!"
"No thanks, it's really ok." Cathy refuses, giggling.
"What about your friend if she stops hiding behind you..." The other guy challenges you with a smirk.
A bit embarrassed, but suddenly feeling a weird connection as they remind you of your former self, you decide you won't hide behind a girl, your male ego suddenly giving you a surprising boost.
"You know, if I stuck to skateboarding, I would probably kick your asses right now..." You come out with a smirk.
"Oh so you already did it before!" The first one says encouragingly. "Come on, then, show us what you got."
Cathy smiles at you briefly, and decides to reward your bravery by helping you out at this point, as they are bound to notice the emptiness of your sleeves any second now.
"Well, I don't think she should, guys, as if you haven't noticed, she's missing both her arms." She fondles one of your sleeves as you try to avoid the looks they are now probably giving you. "But it's no big deal..." she says cheerfully as she sits on a near bench, pulling you by the sleeve to do the same. “Just let us watch for a little while."
And with that, she strokes your thigh to make you more comfortable.
"Oh, I see..." one of the guys says a bit taken aback. “That’s no problem then, if you just wanna look." he quickly recovers. "Though, if she has the courage, we can help her ride around a little bit. It might cheer her up."
Daring to lift your gaze, you see the three guys all give you warm, encouraging grins, making you feel at ease.
"Why not...you know?" You say with a shrug, than stand up. "Just somebody take my jacket off, first." you say, pushing your chest out.
One of the guys approaches you, nervously looking at your ample bosom, pushed-up by the small bra and half zipped jacket. As his trembling hands fiddle under your cleavage for embarrassingly long, Cathy finally stands up and pushes him away, undoing the zipper herself.
"I'm sorry...I...umm...I just...uh..." the guy stammers.
You realize there's a BIG power this body has over guys, which makes you even less afraid. It apparently turns them into babbling idiots.
You then realize with Cathy taking a seat again, nobody seems to realize you still need help. The jacket is still on you and the guys look like they think you'll be able to take it off yourself. You roll your eyes at them.
"Do you expect me to just shake the jacket off and make it fall on the ground? Someone help me out of it!" you say, twisting your back to the guy on your other side, as he quickly nods and reveals your naked shoulders for the rest to see.
"Thanks, hold onto it, please..." you wink at him and turn to the other two.
The looks at their baffled faces making you chuckle, you decide to give them a little show as you squirm your shoulders around nonchalantly. "Why don't you take a picture it'll last longer!"
One of them finally aproaches you with the board. The other two start getting close as well, reaching with their hands to help you on it and give you support, but you hunch your shoulders up in refusal.
"Guys, I won't need you to hold me..." you say, realizing you probably just blew everyone’s mind. "I never learned many tricks, but I was able to do the usual riding and messing about pretty well..."
With that, you bravely step on the skateboard with one foot "Now, let me see if I can still do this..."
"You know, I don't think you should skateboard in high heels..." One of them suddenly points out and you realize he's totally right, all your excitement fading away.
Damn Flora to hell, you think to yourself, she really managed to rob you of any fun you could ever have!
"Hey guys, does she have tinny padlocks on her shoes, or am I seeing things?" One guy notices.
"It's just a decoration." Cathy helps you out as they all look at her. "You see, my friend here is very creative, and she likes to look kind of edgy. There are also these little bells attached, so if you listen closely, the shoes make a bit of a tinkling sound.. I think it's really cool."
"You know, your friend's kind of amazing!" they laugh.
"H-... She is..." Cathy admits proudly and then points your direction, wide-eyed. "Omg, look you guys!"
As everybody turns to you again, they find you miraculously balancing on the board without much of a problem, already getting the feeling for it quite well. Even with no arms, and high heels, you are able to keep in place, roll it back and forth, with natural ease, even rise the front part up for a while to turn yourself around a few times.
You look at them with a triumphant smirk as they give you a round of cheers. You slip down, stamping on the back end of the board to get it to stand up, but then realize you cannot actually pick it up. The owner does it for you though.
"You are not half bad!" he compliments you, lightly touching your side for a second. "You know, it would be neat to have you skate with our little group sometimes, I mean, there is not much girl skateboarders around anyway... and you would make quite a special one..."
"You mean because my lack of arms?" you ask plainly, not letting him slip out of this one.
"Well... yeah... I mean...that's what makes you even more cool, if you want my opinion." He smirks at you.
"Thank you!" you give him a cute smile, preening a little.
"Ok... I think we should go, it's getting late." Cathy suddenly appears behind you with your jacket, preparing to throw it around your shoulders.
"But I don't want to!" you wiggle a bit, slipping out of her reach. "I just found something I'm good at!" you make a face at her and then you jump on the skateboard again and roll away...
For about ten feet...before your heels make you lose balance and you fall, landing actually quite smartly, considering, but still making an idiot of yourself.
You look up to see Cathy running to you, but the guys get to you quicker, the first one holding your head up, the other holds your waist to calm and steady you, the last one shamelessly groping the rest of your body, presumably looking for any injuries. They all keep asking if you're ok and if you hurt anywhere. Feeling all those hands on your petite body, you find yourself feeling totally embarrassed once again.
"Stop it! I'M FINE!" you say and start to pick yourself up awkwardly, telling everyone to let go off you. Getting up from the ground with no arms is no easy task, but you got a lot of practice and you manage to do it with dignity, you at least imagine. Your butt feels sore and you notice a bit of pain on the back of your shoulder, but nothing bad. As you stand up, looking yourself over, you see your skirt hiked up akwardly, so much than everyone can spot your pink panties.
"CATHY!!!" you yell as you shrug helplessly, twisting yourself violently to somehow reach the skirt to make yourself decent. "COULD YOU GIVE ME A HAND HERE FOR GOD'S SAKE?"
"Oh...SORRY!" Christy yells as she notices and rushes to pull your skirt down.
"We would help you earlier if you didn't scream on us to let go off you." says one of the guys.
"I'm sorry...umm...that was really stupid of me...I should've let you help me..." you let out a deep sigh, than wiggle your shoulders, feeling an uncomfortable layer of dirt stuck to them, that you cannot brush off yourself..."So could one of you... maybe...dust me off a bit?"
Again, all these hands on your body as they happily comply... "I said just one, guys!!!" you squeek, but it's no use.
When you're all cleaned up, Cathy looks at you with worry. "Are you sure, you're ok?
"Positive." You say angrily. "However, I really think we should go now..."
"Ok, guys, it was nice meeting you, but we gotta hurry now." Says Cathy, slipping the jacket over you again. "See you guys around."
And ignoring their calls about wanting to hang out with you two some more, maybe exchanging phone numbers and stuff, you flee from the park with Cathy quietly snickering next to you.

1542121111111112111.content:
Rushing away from the skateboarders, you see it's slowly starting to get dark, and you find yourself getting really hungry now.

"This was supposed to be a ten minute walk, Cathy... where is the restaurant?" you say as you emerge on the streets again, luckily not many people around.

"It's really close now." Cathy points to the right end of the block. "Just around the corner there."

You begin to stride in the given direction, sleeves fluttering behind you, Cathy barely keeping up.

"Mark, are you sure you're not hurting anywhere?" she asks, concerned for you.

"I'm fine ok?" You turn abruptly at her, the jacket almost slipping off you, as it's not zipped up this time. "It wasn't such a bad fall, anyway."

"So why are you being like that?" Cathy asks.

"It was embarrassing alright? I'm hungry, and I just want to be done with this trip already." you shrug at her, making the jacket fully slip from one of your shoulders in the process.

"Let me fix this..." Cathy catches it quickly before it falls as you watch the crowd if anybody notices you.

"You have a bruise on your shoulder." she says as she pulls the jacket back at its place.

"It's nothing..." you grit between your teeth.

"Wait a moment, I think I have a Band-Aid in my purse..." Cathy says.

"NOT HERE!"

"Ok... can I zip the jacket for you?"

"Please..." you say as you look down into your cleavage.

"I like how it pushes your boobies together when you have it zipped..." Cathy chuckles.

"If it was possible to zip it all the way up, I would rather have that, but it's too tight!" you say angrily. "And WHAT did you just call them?"

Cathy giggles some more as she pulls the zipper up as far as it lets her. "It looks like they are trying to escape out of the jacket." she giggles again and lightly pokes one of them with her finger, making you flinch.

"STOP!" you pout at her and then turn around, starting to pick up speed again.

"Look at it this way." Cathy says as she runs to your side. "They can act as a distraction for people to not look at your sleeves..."

Then she playfully sticks a finger into the side of your bust again. "...your boobies I mean..." she smirks at you.

"STOP CALLING THEM THAT!" you warn her, trying not to be too loud. "and stop poking them..."




You finally find the restaurant as Cathy walks in first. Nobody gives you much off attention, surprisingly. You take a table in the corner and you try to position yourself so nobody has a clear view of you. The waiter comes and Cathy orders two sodas with a straw. She also orders food for both of you, picking a salad that is healthy and light as well as a steak that she requests to be cut to bite size pieces. The waiter gives you a little weird look, but nods and walks away.

"I think you should take the jacket off now." Cathy brings up carefully.

"I don't think I should... or could for that matter..."

"Come on, it's warm in here let me do it."

You look the tables over, nobody seems to care about you...that is for now... why not start the full freakshow, you think to yourself. "Ok, you can do it..." you sigh.

As Cathy does, you squeeze yourself to the corner even more, your boobs bouncing as you shuffle your but on the bench. "My ass is still a bit sore from the fall..." you half smile at Cathy. "I wish I could massage it with my hands..."

"I can help you with that later..." Cathy winks at you.

As the drinks arrive, the waiter almost drops the plate when he notices your armless shoulders. He regains his professionalism though and you contain your embarrassment. There's nothing else you can do after all.

As Cathy toasts with the glass that is standing in front of you, you glance around, hunched sheepishly. You see few people turning their confused looks away, but that happened on the street too. Seems like they are unable to wrap their head around it, so they leave it be. From this angle, most of them can think you're missing just one arm, anyway.

'Cause that would be almost "normal".

Soon, the food arrives too, the waiter seems like he braced himself to act nonchalantly around you. He doesn't even bring you your utensils.

Cathy then begins to feed you both and you start plan your next moves. The food soon makes you feel better and your quiet conversation shifts to jokes about the skateboarders seeing your naked armlessness for the first time, and how crazy overall this day was.

"...so maybe I can dig up some old stuff after my grandmother, she was kind of this occultist type, you know, medallions, bottles with herbs, I never cared for it, but for all I know now, she could've been a real witch." Cathy finishes trying to recall any potentially "magical" stuff running in her family.

"That would be great. I don't think there's a medailon that gives you extra limbs, though" you say, sipping soda through your straw. "Hey, Cathy... I know it's kind of awkward, but I... I have to go to a toilet, and I will probably need some help with that.."

"Don't say any more, girls always go together, don't they?" Cathy stands up smiling and you both leave the table and disappear into the women's restroom.

You end up in one stall and after Cathy pulls your skirt down, she decides to spend a full minute helping your "sore butt" to get better. Without your permission and against your will, you still end up liking it, and you actually think it helped. She proceeds to help you with your panties, then leaves you to do your business alone and does hers. She then comes back to help you clean with a bit of toilet paper and that's it, not too awkward at all after what you've been through. Before you exit, she also puts the little Band-Aid on your shoulder.

"It feels so weird to not wash my hands afterwards..." you whisper making an icky face, after quickly getting to your table, the short path between it and the toilet being the scariest two trips you took today. You don't even know what kind of looks you got, as you walked almost blindly, keeping your head down, with Cathy gently holding your waist and leading the way.

"I can imagine." Cathy nods, chuckling.

As you take a seat in a hurry, your boobs jiggle around again. You grew really tired of them at this point of the evening, as they kept getting in the way when you tried to lean over the table to talk to Cathy more privately. Which was often, as the majority of your conversation themes were not for other people to hear.

You basically figured it's a question of either having your boobs squished by the side of the table, which is way uncomfortable, or lay them awkwardly on it.

This time around, however, Cathy leans towards you, propping herself up on her arms (which you wish was an option for you). "You know, it's almost dark outside, we should probably go, if we want to cross the park again safely." she says, looking out of the window.

You agree, a bit scared.

As you helplessly watch Cathy pay for everything, you think back to Flora leaving loads of money on your bank account and promise yourself to repay her if this all comes to a happy ending.

You notice that it was much darker than either of you two thought it was, the lights inside the restaurant deceiving you into believing you still had about an hour of light left. Instead the sun was just about to sink under the horizon, only a few slivers of natural light crawling through the builds. "Shit, I didn't think it'd be dark so early. Come on, lets hurry up and get ourselves home." Cathy said, wrapping her arm around your waist and leading you through the park.
You normally didn't fear this part of town. Even at night you felt secure in your own physique enough that you didn't feel vulnerable. Now, both female and lacking any arms you were jumping at every shadow and were struggling not to whimper as you traversed the darkened section of town that before had never bothered you.
Footsteps echoed behind the two of you, just ever so slightly quicker in tempo than the ones made by you and Cathy. Trying to catch a peek without alerting your possible tail you tilt your head to the left and move your eyes as far back as they could go. "Cathy, I think that guy's following us." You wouldn't happen to have a dollar or two to spare now would you?"

15421211111111121111.title: On your way back, you get mugged.

choices: You tell Samantha that you were a guy before.

15421211111111121112.content:
The evening seems fairly warm, and you get Cathy to just drape the jacket over your shoulders unzipped, not wanting her to poke any more fun of your "boobies".

The park is empty, no kids or skateboarders anymore, but you don't feel too scared as it's not that big that you'd expect like... muggers, or something here in the night.

Still, you are an armless girl in a short skirt... if you were alone here at night, you would probably be very nervous.

When you emerge on the street again and turn to walk towards the apartment house you both live in, it's already dark.

Suddenly, you spot a spooky silhouette, like someone in a hoody, standing between you and the house. The figure turns your way, clearly spotting you and immediately starts to walk towards you.

"Who's that?" you stop in your tracks, glancing at Cathy.

"I don't know..." Cathy steps closer to you, getting a hold of your sleeve, like she wants to feel more protected. You would, of course, like to protect her, but right now you are utterly helpless to do so. You realize retreat might be the best option here...

As you motion with your chin, signaling for Cathy to go, you both turn around and start walking the other way, not back into the park, but to the other end of the block.

"STOP!" you hear a familiar voice yell at you.

"SAMANTHA???" Cathy looks back at the shady character.

"Yes! It's me!" Cathy's friend shouts back in anger. "You forgot about our date tonight?"

Cathy gives you worried look. "I didn't forget! I was just about to call you actually... umm... did you prepare a meal for us?" she asks, turning around to look at her.

"Umm...I didn't actually..." Samantha admits as she continues walking towards you. "...but I did something far better!"

"Samantha, you can't keep stalking me like this!" Cathy tries to persuade her, still fondling your empty sleeve in her hands.

"I didn’t mean to... but after I went here and found out you weren't home... I just decided to wait..." she says, getting close enough you can properly see her at last.

She seems to be wearing an unzipped pink sweatshirt, over the same shirt and skinny jeans she was wearing before. She looks desperate.

"I don't know what else to do... I just, need... to be with you..."

"Can't you just go home, Sam?" sights Cathy. "You'll get over it soon, I just... don't think it's healthy for you to be close to me for a while..."

"You don't understand!" She says quietly, shaking. "I cannot go home...I couldn't even get in!"

"Why?" you ask.

"Haven't you noticed?" she looks at you for the first time, giving you a sad smile. "Your sleeves aren't the only empty ones here!"

With absolute horror, you realize her sweatshirt's sleeves also hang limply by her sides. The poor girl is now armless just like you!

"But... HOW?" Cathy asks, reading your mind.

"Does it matter?" Samantha comes even closer, giving Cathy a look full of love. "What actually matters here is... if you like it?" she adds, wiggling her shoulders cutely to showcase her freely bouncing sleeves. You flinch watching this, as your sleeves do the same.

"I cannot believe it!" Cathy running the remaining few steps towards her friend, leaving you behind. "You actually... mutilated yourself... for me? I'll never forgive myself for this!"

"No! Don't be sad, Cathy!" Samantha smiles, giving Cathy an encouraging nod as Cathy starts to take her sweatshirt off her. "Your friend over there explained to me you would never want me to actually hurt myself..."

As you also come closer to inspect, you see Samantha's shoulders are completely smooth and healthy, without even a scar or anything. Which is a real irony now, as even you, though you lost your arms through magical means, have a band-aid on one of your shoulders.

"So I figured out a way!" Samantha hunches her shoulders up in victory, jumping a little. "I recalled the name of the demon you told me about..."

Flora! As always, you think to yourself.

"..that gave you your perfect, amazing dick! And I managed to summoned her! She was more than willing to help me get rid of my arms!"

"Oh my god, Samantha, my stupid, silly friend..." Cathy manages a sad smile and hugs Samantha tightly, which makes Samantha glow with pride and squirm against her a little, enjoying the embrace. "I suppose it's better than jumping under a train." finishes Cathy and gives you a sad look.

Standing next to them helplessly, seeing Cathy hugging another armless girl actually makes you feel a bit jealous. You think Samantha is hiding something. "Hey, Samantha, I guess Flora also made you sign some kind of paper before she took your arms away... didn't she?"

Samantha turns and just looks at you for a while as Cathy let go of her. "I don't remember anything of that kind!" she says. "I'm not stupid you know?"

"Mark, we gotta take her in with us..." Cathy says "I'm sorry, but...she's my friend...and this is all my fault..."

"Of course we cannot leave her on the streets alone with no arms." you give Cathy a smirk. "I can sympathize."

"Splendid!" Samantha beams with joy. "Cathy just needs to take my backpack over there... as we can't" She winks at you. "Hey, is your name really Mark? That's not a girl's name, is it?"

"That's a long story..." you begin as Cathy drapes the sweatshirt back over Samantha's shoulders and you all begin to walk slowly towards the front door.

154212111111111211121.content:
"So let me get this straight, you weren't always a girl?" Samantha questions you as you walk upstairs.
You shake your head no. "I was a normal, young dude. With two arms. Then, just like you and Cathy, I ended up being a victim of Flora's magic."
"I'm not a victim..." Samantha points out, lifting her chin up "I wanted to be like this, for Cathy. And it was totally worth it." she grins in Cathy's direction.
"I didn't ask for this, Sam!" Cathy glances back at you two, as she's pulling out her keys.
"You see?" you smirk at her "You made yourself completely helpless for nothing!" you immediately regret saying that as Samantha begins to sob.
"That was a terrible thing to say, especially coming from you!" Cathy frowns at you, pulling Samantha in for another hug.
You just roll your eyes, and slightly kick the half opened door to let yourself inside the apartment.

After Cathy's done solacing Samantha, she drops the backpack in and closes the door behind you all.
"So, now I have two little babies here to take care of." she chuckles, fondling one empty sleeve of each of you as she stands between you two.
"I am a grown, adult woman!" You push your busty chest out to prove it. "I think Sam is gonna be the one to take care of here, as she's also new to being armless."
Samantha puffs her chest out too, but her little breasts can hardly have the same effect. "I'm not a baby either! And as oppose to you, I can do stuff with my feet, maybe, yours seem to be locked in those shoes."
"Oh yeah... on that problem... I'm really tired of walking in those heels..." You look at Cathy. "Could we try to get them off? Like maybe cut the ankle straps carefully with a knife or something?"
"You want to destroy the shoes?" Cathy exclaims. "They are such a nice, stylish boots!"
You look at her in disbelief. "Well...would you rather try to saw the shackles with a hack saw?"

"Maybe we can ask the other neighbors around the house, some guy has to have it." Samantha shrugs as she comes closer.
"Why you girls have to make things so complicated?!" you feel your voice getting squeaky again. "Just take a knife and help me out of my misery."
They begin to chuckle at how that sounded. "Hey, we are trying to help!" says Cathy after she stops laughing. "I'm gonna have to be the one to ask around the house for it, as I'm the only one who looks normal. Just let me give the shoes a chance to live. If it doesn't work, we cut them up."

"Ok, whatever, but only if you do it now, it's already getting late and I don't want to end up having to sleep in them!" you say, walking away from the girls and laying yourself on the couch.

"I'm on my way... Hey Sam, what is in the backpack you brought, anyway?" She asks as she sees it laying next to the door.
"Oh... just some personal stuff..." Samantha squirms sheepishly.
"Samantha... are you not telling us something important?" Cathy looks at her sharply.
"Umm... well... if you have to know... I mean... you're gonna find out sooner or later, so, just look for yourself..."
You pick yourself up as you watch Cathy from the couch.

As she opens the bag, she screams. After a few seconds to calm down, she slowly picks something "fleshy" and pulls it out of the bag.
"Sam! is this... YOUR ARM???"
"Yep... I told you I'm not stupid..." she gives you a proud look. "Rather than letting Flora just take my arms away, I asked her to make parts of me detachable..."
"So you can stick them back whenever you want???" you scream with envy from the couch.
"I suppose so... I never tried... but... does it make my..." she shrugs her armless frame giving Cathy a sad look "...state less attractive to you Cathy? As it's not as real...as Mark's?"
You roll your eyes and limply fall back on the couch.
"Samantha!" Cathy cannot help but laugh. "You aren't so silly after all! Let me stick them back on you!"
"NO!" Samantha screams, hunching her armless shoulders up. "I wan't to stay like this!"
"You don't have to! I want you to have arms, really! Umm... can you still feel them?" Cathy asks curiously, stroking the one she's holding with a finger.
"Not when they are detached. I cannot feel them, or move them. They are just... something I brought...in case..."
"Can you try and stick them on me?" you suddenly realize, standing up.
"Yes!" yells Samantha happily. "Give them to Mark! He can then go home and leave us alone!"
"Will it work?" Cathy frowns as she thinks about it. "I suppose we can try. Come here, Mark."
You run to Cathy, overwhelmed with anticipation. "Do it!" you wiggle your shoulder at her.

Cathy makes shure it's the right one, and pushes the end of the arm into your shoulder. And it sticks!!! Soon enough, the seam disappears and other than a little change of skin tone, the arm looks like it belongs to your body!
"Do the other one!" you yell with excitement, holding your hand up and moving it. "ACTUALLY! Let me do the other one!" you squeak as you skip to the bag and pull the other arm out of it. With a bit of fiddling, you manage to grasp it the right way and stick it to your other shoulder.
"IT WORKS! I have arms!"

You all cheer for a bit.
"So, you can now go to your place, if you want to take the rest of the matters in your hands. You're not depending on me anymore..." Cathy says with a hint of sadness.
"What are you talking about Cathy?" You smile and hold her waist lovingly with your hands, pulling her close. "I don't intend to leave! I couldn't get in my apartment anyway, I locked myself out."
"Crap." Samantha says quietly.
Cathy puts her hand on your cheek and smiles at you too. "If you want to stay, you are welcome to. We still want to get your old body back and get rid of my... you know. If you want to do it together..."
